name: Estela Diaz
title: Software Engineer
description: Creative and energetic Full-Stack Software Engineer with an eye for design and a love for building delightful user experiences.
Built editing features and unit tests for logging agent timecards and schedules using Ruby on Rails and React.js.
Created a Storybook to house components library used in agent dashboards and Chrome extension.
Aided in recruiting efforts by copywriting job posts and reviewing applicants.

Migrated easypost.com from Jekyll to Next.js, including a sitewide redesign of EasyPost's marketing website and product dashboard. Upon launch, some pages (ex. Pricing) saw an increase in CTR as high as 52%.

Maintained and built new features into EasyPost's React.js Components Library in Storybook, creating stories to document component use cases. Collaborated closely with Designers to ensure pixel-perfect development.
Lead creation of reuseable email modules for the Facebook/Instagram Business CMS.
Collaborated with Designers and Data Scientists to create personalized landing pages for Facebook and Instagram Business acquisition.

Built content modules and a template cloner for commonly requested marketing pages using Express.js and the Contentful API. Reduced the time needed to create Case Study, Partner, and Product pages from a full business day to a few minutes.
Re-designed style implementation across Segment.com using page-level themeing with Emotion.js.

education.name: General Assembly
education.description: Focused on creating accessible websites with HTML5, CSS3, and JavaScript (ES6).

education.name: Agile Learning Labs
education.description: Learned to integrate Agile development and best practices to company workflows and be part of a Development team’s daily stand-ups, backlog grooming, sprint planning, and more.
